Home > io > importExcelModel.m

importExcelModel

PURPOSE

importExcelModel

SYNOPSIS

function model=importExcelModel(fileName,removeExcMets,printWarnings,ignoreErrors)

DESCRIPTION 

 importExcelModel
   Imports a constraint-based model from a Excel file

   fileName      a Microsoft Excel file to import
   removeExcMets true if exchange metabolites should be removed. This is
                 needed to be able to run simulations, but it could also
                 be done using simplifyModel at a later stage (opt,
                 default true)
   printWarnings true if warnings should be printed (opt, default true)
   ignoreErrors  true if errors should be ignored. See below for details
                 (opt, default false)

   model
       description      description of model contents
       id               model ID
       rxns             reaction ids
       mets             metabolite ids
       S                stoichiometric matrix
       lb               lower bounds
       ub               upper bounds
       rev              reversibility vector
       c                objective coefficients
       b                equality constraints for the metabolite equations
       comps            compartment ids
       compNames        compartment names
       compOutside      the id (as in comps) for the compartment
                        surrounding each of the compartments
       compMiriams      structure with MIRIAM information about the
                        compartments
       rxnNames         reaction description
       rxnComps         compartments for reactions
       grRules          reaction to gene rules in text form
       rxnGeneMat       reaction-to-gene mapping in sparse matrix form
       subSystems       subsystem name for each reaction
       eccodes          EC-codes for the reactions
       rxnMiriams       structure with MIRIAM information about the reactions
       rxnNotes         reaction notes
       rxnReferences   reaction references
       confidenceScores reaction confidence scores
       genes            list of all genes
       geneComps        compartments for reactions
       geneMiriams      structure with MIRIAM information about the genes
       metNames         metabolite description
       metComps         compartments for metabolites
       inchis           InChI-codes for metabolites
       metFormulas      metabolite chemical formula
       metMiriams       structure with MIRIAM information about the metabolites
       metCharge        metabolite charge
       unconstrained    true if the metabolite is an exchange metabolite

   Loads models in the RAVEN Toolbox Excel format. A number of consistency
   checks are performed in order to ensure that the model is valid. These
   can be ignored by putting ignoreErrors to true. However, this is highly
   advised against, as it can result in errors in simulations or other
   functionalities. The RAVEN Toolbox is made to function only on consistent
   models, and the only checks performed are when the model is imported.

   NOTE: Most errors are checked for by checkModelStruct, but some
   are checked for in this function as well. Those are ones which relate
   to missing model elements and so on, and which would make it impossible
   to construct the model structure. Those errors cannot be ignored by
   setting ignoreErrors to true.

   Usage: model=importExcelModel(fileName,removeExcMets,printWarnings,ignoreErrors)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2016-11-01 - added support for rxnNotes,
   rxnReferences, confidenceScores and metCharge

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • cleanSheet cleanSheet
  • loadSheet loadSheet
  • loadWorkbook loadWorkbook
This function is called by:
  • SBMLFromExcel SBMLFromExcel

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function miriamStruct=parseMiriam(strings,miriamStruct)
  • function y=toStr(x)
  • function y=toDouble(x,default)
  • function y=boolToDouble(x)

SOURCE CODE

0002 % importExcelModel
0003 %   Imports a constraint-based model from a Excel file
0004 %
0005 %   fileName      a Microsoft Excel file to import

0007 %                 needed to be able to run simulations, but it could also

0012 %                 (opt, default false)

0016 %       id               model ID

0018 %       mets             metabolite ids

0053 %   checks are performed in order to ensure that the model is valid. These
0054 %   can be ignored by putting ignoreErrors to true. However, this is highly
0055 %   advised against, as it can result in errors in simulations or other
0056 %   functionalities. The RAVEN Toolbox is made to function only on consistent
0057 %   models, and the only checks performed are when the model is imported.
0058 %

0063 %   setting ignoreErrors to true.
0064 %

0066 %
0067 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2016-11-01 - added support for rxnNotes,
0068 %   rxnReferences, confidenceScores and metCharge
0069 %
0070 
0071 if nargin<2
0072     removeExcMets=true;
0073 end
0074 if nargin<3
0075     printWarnings=true;
0076 end
0077 if nargin<4
0078     ignoreErrors=false;
0079 end
0080 
0081 %This is to match the order of the fields to those you get from importing
0082 %from SBML
0083 model=[];
0084 model.id=[];
0085 model.description=[];
0086 model.annotation=[];
0087 %Default bounds if not defined
0088 model.annotation.defaultLB=-1000;
0089 model.annotation.defaultUB=1000;

0091 model.mets={};

0094 model.ub=[];

0123 workbook=loadWorkbook(fileName);
0124 
0125 [raw, flag]=loadSheet(workbook,'MODEL');
0126 
0127 if flag<0
0128     if printWarnings==true
0129         EM='Could not load the MODEL sheet';
0130         dispEM(EM,false);
0131     end
0132     model.id='UNKNOWN';
0133     model.description='No model details available';
0134 else
0135     raw=cleanSheet(raw);
0136 
0137     %It is assumed that the first line is labels and that the second one is
0138     %info
0139     allLabels={'ID';'DESCRIPTION';'DEFAULT LOWER';'DEFAULT UPPER';'CONTACT GIVEN NAME';'CONTACT FAMILY NAME';'CONTACT EMAIL';'ORGANIZATION';'TAXONOMY';'NOTES'};
0140 
0141     %Map to new captions
0142     raw(1,:)=upper(raw(1,:));
0143     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'MODELID','ID');
0144     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'MODELNAME','DESCRIPTION');
0145 
0146     %Loop through the labels
0147     [I, J]=ismember(raw(1,:),allLabels);
0148     I=find(I);
0149     for i=1:numel(I)
0150         switch J(I(i))
0151             case 1
0152                 if any(raw{I(i),2})
0153                     model.id=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0154                 else
0155                     EM='No model ID supplied';
0156                     dispEM(EM);
0157                 end
0158             case 2
0159                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0160                     model.description=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0161                 else
0162                     EM='No model name supplied';
0163                     dispEM(EM);
0164                 end
0165             case 3
0166                 if ~isempty(raw{2,I(i)})
0167                     try
0168                         model.annotation.defaultLB=toDouble(raw{2,I(i)},NaN);
0169                     catch
0170                         EM='DEFAULT LOWER must be numeric';
0171                         dispEM(EM);
0172                     end
0173                 else
0174                     if printWarnings==true
0175                         fprintf('NOTE: DEFAULT LOWER not supplied. Uses -1000\n');
0176                     end
0177                     model.annotation.defaultLB=-1000;
0178                 end
0179             case 4
0180                 if ~isempty(raw{2,I(i)})
0181                     try
0182                         model.annotation.defaultUB=toDouble(raw{2,I(i)},NaN);
0183                     catch
0184                         EM='DEFAULT UPPER must be numeric';
0185                         dispEM(EM);
0186                     end
0187                 else
0188                     if printWarnings==true
0189                         fprintf('NOTE: DEFAULT UPPER not supplied. Uses 1000\n');
0190                     end
0191                     model.annotation.defaultUB=1000;
0192                 end
0193             case 5
0194                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0195                     model.annotation.givenName=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0196                 end
0197             case 6
0198                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0199                     model.annotation.familyName=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0200                 end
0201             case 7
0202                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0203                     model.annotation.email=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0204                 end
0205             case 8
0206                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0207                     model.annotation.organization=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0208                 end
0209             case 9
0210                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0211                     model.annotation.taxonomy=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0212                 end
0213             case 10
0214                 if any(raw{2,I(i)})
0215                     model.annotation.note=toStr(raw{2,I(i)}); %Should be string already
0216                 end
0217         end
0218     end
0219 end
0220 
0221 %Get compartment information
0222 [raw, flag]=loadSheet(workbook,'COMPS');
0223 
0224 if flag<0
0225     if printWarnings==true
0226         EM='Could not load the COMPS sheet. All elements will be assigned to a compartment "s" for "System"';
0227         dispEM(EM,false);
0228     end
0229     model.comps={'s'};
0230     model.compNames={'System'};
0231 else
0232     raw=cleanSheet(raw);
0233 
0234     %Map to new captions
0235     raw(1,:)=upper(raw(1,:));
0236     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'COMPABBREV','ABBREVIATION');
0237     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'COMPNAME','NAME');
0238 
0239     allLabels={'ABBREVIATION';'NAME';'INSIDE';'MIRIAM'};
0240 
0241     %Loop through the labels
0242     [I, J]=ismember(raw(1,:),allLabels);
0243     I=find(I);
0244     for i=1:numel(I)
0245         switch J(I(i))
0246             case 1
0247                 model.comps=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0248             case 2
0249                 model.compNames=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0250             case 3
0251                 model.compOutside=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0252             case 4
0253                 model.compMiriams=raw(2:end,I(i));
0254         end
0255     end
0256 
0257     %Check that necessary fields are loaded
0258     if isempty(model.comps)
0259         EM='There must be a column named ABBREVIATION in the COMPS sheet';
0260         dispEM(EM);
0261     end
0262     if isempty(model.compNames)
0263         model.compNames=model.comps;
0264         if printWarnings==true
0265             EM='There is no column named NAME in the COMPS sheet. ABBREVIATION will be used as name';
0266             dispEM(EM,false);
0267         end
0268     end
0269 
0270     model.compMiriams=parseMiriam(model.compMiriams);
0271 end
0272 
0273 %Get all the genes and info about them
0274 [raw, flag]=loadSheet(workbook,'GENES');
0275 
0276 if flag<0
0277     if printWarnings==true
0278         EM='There is no spreadsheet named GENES';
0279         dispEM(EM,false)
0280     end
0281 else
0282     raw=cleanSheet(raw);
0283 
0284     %Map to new captions
0285     raw(1,:)=upper(raw(1,:));
0286     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'GENE NAME','NAME');
0287 
0288     allLabels={'NAME';'MIRIAM';'COMPARTMENT'};
0289 
0290     %Loop through the labels
0291     [I, J]=ismember(upper(raw(1,:)),allLabels);
0292     I=find(I);
0293     foundGenes=false;
0294     for i=1:numel(I)
0295         switch J(I(i))
0296             case 1
0297                 model.genes=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0298                 foundGenes=true;
0299             case 2
0300                 model.geneMiriams=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0301             case 3
0302                 model.geneComps=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0303         end
0304     end
0305 
0306     if foundGenes==false
0307         EM='There must be a column named NAME in the GENES sheet';
0308         dispEM(EM);
0309     end
0310 
0311     %Its ok if all of them are empty
0312     if all(cellfun(@isempty,model.geneComps))
0313         model.geneComps=[];
0314     end
0315 
0316     %Check that geneName contain only strings and no empty strings
0317     if ~iscellstr(model.genes)
0318         EM='All gene names have to be strings';
0319         dispEM(EM);
0320     else
0321         if any(strcmp('',model.genes))
0322             EM='There can be no empty strings in gene names';
0323             dispEM(EM);
0324         end
0325     end
0326 
0327     %Check that geneComp contains only strings and no empty string
0328     if ~isempty(model.geneComps)
0329         if ~iscellstr(model.geneComps)
0330             EM='All gene compartments have to be strings';
0331             dispEM(EM);
0332         else
0333             if any(strcmp('',model.geneComps))
0334                 EM='There can be no empty strings in gene compartments';
0335                 dispEM(EM);
0336             end
0337         end
0338         [I, model.geneComps]=ismember(model.geneComps,model.comps);
0339         EM='The following genes have compartment abbreviations which could not be found:';
0340         dispEM(EM,true,model.genes(~I));
0341     end
0342 end
0343 
0344 model.geneMiriams=parseMiriam(model.geneMiriams);
0345 
0346 %Loads the reaction data
0347 [raw, flag]=loadSheet(workbook,'RXNS');
0348 
0349 if flag<0
0350     EM='Could not load the RXNS sheet';
0351     dispEM(EM);
0352 end
0353 
0354 raw=cleanSheet(raw);
0355 
0356 %Map to new captions
0357 raw(1,:)=upper(raw(1,:));
0358 raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'RXNID','ID');
0359 
0360 allLabels={'ID';'NAME';'EQUATION';'EC-NUMBER';'GENE ASSOCIATION';'LOWER BOUND';'UPPER BOUND';'OBJECTIVE';'COMPARTMENT';'SUBSYSTEM';'REPLACEMENT ID';'MIRIAM';'NOTE';'REFERENCE';'CONFIDENCE SCORE'};
0361 equations={};
0362 reactionReplacement={};
0363 
0364 %Loop through the labels
0365 [I, J]=ismember(raw(1,:),allLabels);
0366 I=find(I);
0367 for i=1:numel(I)
0368     switch J(I(i))
0369         case 1
0370            model.rxns=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0371         case 2
0372            model.rxnNames=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0373         case 3
0374            equations=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0375         case 4
0376            model.eccodes=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0377         case 5
0378            model.grRules=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0379         case 6
0380            try
0381                model.lb=cellfun(@(x) toDouble(x,NaN),raw(2:end,I(i)));
0382            catch
0383                EM='The lower bounds must be numerical values';
0384                dispEM(EM);
0385            end
0386         case 7
0387            try
0388                model.ub=cellfun(@(x) toDouble(x,NaN),raw(2:end,I(i)));
0389            catch
0390                EM='The upper bounds must be numerical values';
0391                dispEM(EM);
0392            end
0393         case 8
0394            try
0395                model.c=cellfun(@(x) toDouble(x,0),raw(2:end,I(i)));
0396            catch
0397                EM='The objective coefficients must be numerical values';
0398                dispEM(EM);
0399            end
0400         case 9
0401             model.rxnComps=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0402         case 10
0403             model.subSystems=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0404         case 11
0405             reactionReplacement=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0406         case 12
0407             model.rxnMiriams=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0408         case 13
0409             model.rxnNotes=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0410         case 14
0411             model.rxnReferences=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0412         case 15
0413             model.confidenceScores=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0414     end
0415 end
0416 
0417 %Check that all necessary reaction info has been loaded
0418 if isempty(equations)
0419     EM='There must be a column named EQUATION in the RXNS sheet';
0420     dispEM(EM);
0421 end
0422 if isempty(model.rxns)
0423      if printWarnings==true
0424          EM='There is no column named ID in the RXNS sheet. The reactions will be named as "r1", "r2"...';
0425          dispEM(EM,false);
0426      end
0427      I=num2cell((1:numel(equations))');
0428      model.rxns=strcat('r',cellfun(@num2str,I,'UniformOutput',false));
0429 end
0430 
0431 %Check if some other stuff is loaded and populate with default values
0432 %otherwise
0433 if isempty(model.rxnNames)
0434    model.rxnNames=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0435    model.rxnNames(:)={''};
0436    if printWarnings==true
0437        EM='There is no column named NAME in the RXNS sheet. Empty strings will be used as reaction names';
0438        dispEM(EM,false);
0439    end
0440 end
0441 if isempty(model.lb)
0442    %This is not set here since the reversibility isn't known yet
0443    model.lb=nan(numel(model.rxns),1);
0444    if printWarnings==true
0445        EM='There is no column named LOWER BOUND in the RXNS sheet. Default bounds will be used';
0446        dispEM(EM,false);
0447    end
0448 end
0449 if isempty(model.ub)
0450    model.ub=nan(numel(model.rxns),1);
0451    if printWarnings==true
0452        EM='There is no column named UPPER BOUND in the RXNS sheet. Default bounds will be used';
0453        dispEM(EM,false);
0454    end
0455 end
0456 if isempty(model.c)
0457    model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0458    if printWarnings==true
0459        EM='There is no column named OBJECTIVE in the RXNS sheet';
0460        dispEM(EM,false);
0461    end
0462 end
0463 
0464 %Either all reactions must have a compartment string or none of them.
0465 %Check if it's only empty and if so return it to []
0466 if ~isempty(model.rxnComps)
0467     if all(cellfun(@isempty,model.rxnComps))
0468         model.rxnComps=[];
0469     end
0470 end
0471 
0472 %Construct the rxnMiriams structure
0473 model.rxnMiriams=parseMiriam(model.rxnMiriams);
0474 
0475 %Replace the reaction IDs for those IDs that have a corresponding
0476 %replacement name.
0477 I=cellfun(@any,reactionReplacement);
0478 model.rxns(I)=reactionReplacement(I);
0479 
0480 %Check that there are no empty strings in reactionIDs or equations
0481 if any(strcmp('',model.rxns))
0482     EM='There are empty reaction IDs';
0483     dispEM(EM);
0484 end
0485 
0486 if any(strcmp('',equations))
0487     EM='There are empty equations';
0488     dispEM(EM);
0489 end
0490 
0491 if ~isempty(model.rxnComps)
0492     if any(strcmp('',model.rxnComps))
0493         EM='Either all reactions must have an associated compartment string or none of them';
0494         dispEM(EM);
0495     end
0496 end
0497 
0498 %Check gene association for each reaction and populate rxnGeneMat
0499 if ~isempty(model.genes)
0500     model.rxnGeneMat=zeros(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
0501 end
0502 if ~isempty(model.grRules)
0503     for i=1:length(model.rxns)
0504        %Check that all gene associations have a match in the gene list
0505        if ~isempty(model.grRules{i})
0506            indexes=strfind(model.grRules{i},':'); %Genes are separated by ":" for AND and ";" for OR
0507            indexes=unique([indexes strfind(model.grRules{i},';')]);
0508            if isempty(indexes)
0509                %See if you have a match
0510                I=find(strcmp(model.grRules{i},model.genes));
0511                if isempty(I)
0512                    EM=['The gene association in reaction ' model.rxns{i} ' (' model.grRules{i} ') is not present in the gene list'];
0513                    dispEM(EM);
0514                end
0515                model.rxnGeneMat(i,I)=1;
0516            else
0517                temp=[0 indexes numel(model.grRules{i})+1];
0518                for j=1:numel(indexes)+1;
0519                    %The reaction has several associated genes
0520                    geneName=model.grRules{i}(temp(j)+1:temp(j+1)-1);
0521                    I=find(strcmp(geneName,model.genes));
0522                    if isempty(I)
0523                        EM=['The gene association in reaction ' model.rxns{i} ' (' geneName ') is not present in the gene list'];
0524                        dispEM(EM);
0525                    end
0526                    model.rxnGeneMat(i,I)=1;
0527                end
0528            end
0529             %In order to adhere to the COBRA standards it should be like
0530             %this:
0531             %-If only one gene then no parentheses
0532             %-If only "and" or only "or" there should only be one set of
0533             %parentheses
0534             %-If both "and" and "or", then split on "or". This is not
0535             %complete, but it's the type of relationship supported by the
0536             %Excel formulation
0537             aSign=strfind(model.grRules{i},':');
0538             oSign=strfind(model.grRules{i},';');
0539             if isempty(aSign) && isempty(oSign)
0540                 model.grRules{i}=model.grRules{i};
0541             else
0542                 if isempty(aSign)
0543                     model.grRules{i}=['(' strrep(model.grRules{i},';',' or ') ')'];
0544                 else
0545                     if isempty(oSign)
0546                         model.grRules{i}=['(' strrep(model.grRules{i},':',' and ') ')'];
0547                     else
0548                         model.grRules{i}=['((' strrep(model.grRules{i},';',') or (') '))'];
0549                         model.grRules{i}=strrep(model.grRules{i},':',' and ');
0550                     end
0551                 end
0552             end
0553        end
0554     end
0555 end
0556 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(model.rxnGeneMat);
0557 
0558 %Check that the compartment for each reaction can be found
0559 if ~isempty(model.rxnComps)
0560     [I, model.rxnComps]=ismember(model.rxnComps,model.comps);
0561     EM='The following reactions have compartment abbreviations which could not be found:';
0562     dispEM(EM,true,model.rxns(~I));
0563 end
0564 
0565 %Get all the metabolites and info about them
0566 [raw, flag]=loadSheet(workbook,'METS');
0567 
0568 if flag<0
0569     if printWarnings==true
0570         EM='There is no spreadsheet named METS. The metabolites will be named "m1", "m2"... and assigned to the first compartment';
0571         dispEM(EM,false);
0572     end
0573     %Parse the equations to find out how many metabolites there are
0574     metsForParsing=parseRxnEqu(equations);
0575     I=num2cell((1:numel(metsForParsing))');
0576     model.mets=strcat('m',cellfun(@num2str,I,'UniformOutput',false));
0577     model.metComps=ones(numel(model.mets),1);
0578     model.unconstrained=zeros(numel(model.mets),1);
0579     model.metNames=metsForParsing;
0580 else
0581     raw=cleanSheet(raw);
0582 
0583     %Map to new captions
0584     raw(1,:)=upper(raw(1,:));
0585     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'METID','ID');
0586     raw(1,:)=strrep(raw(1,:),'METNAME','NAME');
0587 
0588     allLabels={'ID';'NAME';'UNCONSTRAINED';'MIRIAM';'COMPOSITION';'INCHI';'COMPARTMENT';'REPLACEMENT ID';'CHARGE'};
0589 
0590     %Load the metabolite information
0591     metReplacement={};
0592 
0593     %Loop through the labels
0594     [I, J]=ismember(raw(1,:),allLabels);
0595     I=find(I);
0596     for i=1:numel(I)
0597         switch J(I(i))
0598             case 1
0599                model.mets=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0600             case 2
0601                model.metNames=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0602             case 3
0603                model.unconstrained=cellfun(@boolToDouble,raw(2:end,I(i)));
0604 
0605                %NaN is returned if the values couldn't be parsed
0606                EM='The UNCONSTRAINED property for the following metabolites must be "true"/"false", 1/0, TRUE/FALSE or not set:';
0607                dispEM(EM,true,model.mets(isnan(model.unconstrained)));
0608             case 4
0609                model.metMiriams=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0610             case 5
0611                model.metFormulas=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0612             case 6
0613                model.inchis=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0614             case 7
0615                 model.metComps=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0616 
0617                 %Check that all metabolites have compartments defined
0618                 if any(strcmp('',model.metComps))
0619                     EM='All metabolites must have an associated compartment string';
0620                     dispEM(EM);
0621                 end
0622             case 8
0623                metReplacement=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0624             case 9
0625                model.metCharge=cellfun(@toStr,raw(2:end,I(i)),'UniformOutput',false);
0626         end
0627     end
0628 
0629     %Check that necessary fields are loaded (METID)
0630     if isempty(model.mets)
0631         EM='There must be a column named ID in the METS sheet';
0632         dispEM(EM);
0633     end
0634 
0635     %Check that some other stuff is loaded and use default values otherwise
0636     if isempty(model.metNames)
0637        model.metNames=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0638        if printWarnings==true
0639            EM='There is no column named NAME in the METS sheet. ID will be used as name';
0640            dispEM(EM,false);
0641        end
0642     end
0643     if isempty(model.unconstrained)
0644        model.unconstrained=zeros(numel(model.mets),1);
0645        if printWarnings==true
0646            EM='There is no column named UNCONSTRAINED in the METS sheet. All metabolites will be constrained';
0647            dispEM(EM,false);
0648        end
0649     end
0650 
0651     if isempty(model.metComps)
0652        model.metComps=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0653        model.metComps(:)=model.comps(1);
0654        if printWarnings==true
0655            EM='There is no column named COMPARTMENT in the METS sheet. All metabolites will be assigned to the first compartment in COMPS. Note that RAVEN makes extensive use of metabolite names and compartments. Some features will therefore not function correctly if metabolite compartments are not correctly assigned';
0656            dispEM(EM,false);
0657        end
0658     end
0659 
0660     %The composition should be loaded from InChIs when available
0661     I=find(~cellfun(@isempty,model.inchis));
0662     for i=1:numel(I)
0663         S=regexp(model.inchis(I(i)),'/','split');
0664         S=S{1};
0665         if numel(S)>=2
0666             %Don't copy if it doesn't look good
0667             model.metFormulas(I(i))=S(2);
0668         end
0669     end
0670 
0671     %Check that the compartment for each metabolite can be found. Also convert
0672     %from id to index
0673     [I, model.metComps]=ismember(model.metComps,model.comps);
0674     EM='The following metabolites have compartment abbreviations which could not be found:';
0675     dispEM(EM,true,model.mets(~I));
0676 
0677     %Check that the model.mets vector is unique. The problem is that
0678     %the checkModelStruct cannot check for that since only the metReplacements
0679     %(if used) end up in the model structure
0680     I=false(numel(model.mets),1);
0681     [J, K]=unique(model.mets);
0682     if numel(J)~=numel(model.mets)
0683         L=1:numel(model.mets);
0684         L(K)=[];
0685         I(L)=true;
0686     end
0687     EM='The following metabolites are duplicates:';
0688     dispEM(EM,~ignoreErrors,model.mets(I));
0689 
0690     %Check that there are no metabolite IDs which are numbers. This would
0691     %give errors when parsing the equations
0692     I=cellfun(@str2double,model.mets);
0693     EM='The following metabolites have names which cannot be distinguished from numbers:';
0694     dispEM(EM,~ignoreErrors,model.mets(~isnan(I)));
0695     I=cellfun(@str2double,metReplacement);
0696     EM='The following metabolites have names which cannot be distinguished from numbers:';
0697     dispEM(EM,~ignoreErrors,metReplacement(~isnan(I)));
0698 
0699     %Replace the metabolite IDs for those IDs that have a corresponding
0700     %replacement metabolite. This is not used for matching, but will be checked
0701     %for consistency with SBML naming conventions
0702     metsForParsing=model.mets; %This is because the equations are written with this
0703     I=cellfun(@any,metReplacement);
0704     model.mets(I)=metReplacement(I);
0705 
0706     %If the metabolite name isn't set, replace it with the metabolite id
0707     I=~cellfun(@any,model.metNames);
0708     model.metNames(I)=model.mets(I);
0709 
0710     %Construct the metMiriams structure
0711     model.metMiriams=parseMiriam(model.metMiriams);
0712 
0713     %Either all metabolites have charge or none of them.
0714     %Check if it's only empty and if so return it to []
0715     if ~isempty(model.metCharge)
0716         if all(cellfun(@isempty,model.metCharge))
0717             model.metCharge=[];
0718         end
0719     end
0720     if ~isempty(model.metCharge)
0721         if any(strcmp('',model.metCharge))
0722             EM='Either all metabolites have charge information or none of them';
0723             dispEM(EM);
0724         end
0725     end
0726     if ~isempty(model.metCharge)
0727         model.metCharge=str2double(model.metCharge);
0728     end
0729 end
0730 
0731 %Everything seems fine with the metabolite IDs, compartments, genes, and
0732 %reactions
0733 
0734 %Parse the equations
0735 [model.S, mets, badRxns, model.rev]=constructS(equations,metsForParsing,model.rxns);
0736 model.rev=model.rev*1; %Typecast to double
0737 
0738 %Add default constraints
0739 model.lb(isnan(model.lb))=model.annotation.defaultLB.*model.rev(isnan(model.lb));
0740 model.ub(isnan(model.ub))=model.annotation.defaultUB;
0741 
0742 %Reorder the S matrix so that it fits with the metabolite list in the
0743 %structure
0744 [~, I]=ismember(mets,metsForParsing);
0745 model.S=model.S(I,:);
0746 
0747 %Print warnings about the reactions which contain the same metabolite as
0748 %both reactants and products
0749 EM='The following reactions have metabolites which are present more than once. Only the net reactions will be exported:';
0750 dispEM(EM,false,model.rxns(badRxns));
0751 
0752 model.b=zeros(numel(model.mets),1);
0753 
0754 %Remove unused fields
0755 if isempty(model.compOutside)
0756     model=rmfield(model,'compOutside');
0757 end
0758 if isempty(model.compMiriams)
0759     model=rmfield(model,'compMiriams');
0760 end
0761 if isempty(model.rxnComps)
0762     model=rmfield(model,'rxnComps');
0763 end
0764 if isempty(model.grRules)
0765     model=rmfield(model,'grRules');
0766 end
0767 if isempty(model.rxnGeneMat)
0768     model=rmfield(model,'rxnGeneMat');
0769 end
0770 if isempty(model.subSystems)
0771     model=rmfield(model,'subSystems');
0772 end
0773 if isempty(model.eccodes)
0774     model=rmfield(model,'eccodes');
0775 end
0776 if isempty(model.rxnMiriams)
0777     model=rmfield(model,'rxnMiriams');
0778 end
0779 if isempty(model.rxnNotes)
0780        model=rmfield(model,'rxnNotes');
0781 end
0782 if isempty(model.rxnReferences)
0783        model=rmfield(model,'rxnReferences');
0784 end
0785 if isempty(model.confidenceScores)
0786        model=rmfield(model,'confidenceScores');
0787 end
0788 if isempty(model.genes)
0789     model=rmfield(model,'genes');
0790 end
0791 if isempty(model.geneComps)
0792     model=rmfield(model,'geneComps');
0793 end
0794 if isempty(model.geneMiriams)
0795     model=rmfield(model,'geneMiriams');
0796 end
0797 if isempty(model.inchis)
0798     model=rmfield(model,'inchis');
0799 end
0800 if isempty(model.metFormulas)
0801     model=rmfield(model,'metFormulas');
0802 end
0803 if isempty(model.metMiriams)
0804     model=rmfield(model,'metMiriams');
0805 end
0806 if isempty(model.metCharge)
0807     model=rmfield(model,'metCharge');
0808 end
0809 
0810 %The model structure has now been reconstructed but it can still contain
0811 %many types of errors. The checkModelConsistency function is used to make
0812 %sure that naming and mapping of stuff looks good
0813 checkModelStruct(model,~ignoreErrors);
0814 
0815 if removeExcMets==true
0816     model=simplifyModel(model);
0817 end
0818 end
0819 
0820 function miriamStruct=parseMiriam(strings,miriamStruct)
0821 %Gets the names and values of Miriam-string. Nothing fancy at all, just to
0822 %prevent using the same code for metabolites, genes, and reactions. The
0823 %function also allows for supplying a miriamStruct and the info will then
0824 %be added
0825 
0826 if nargin<2
0827     miriamStruct=cell(numel(strings),1);
0828 end
0829 for i=1:numel(strings)
0830     if any(strings{i})
0831         %A Miriam string can be several ids separated by ";". Each id is
0832         %"name(..:..):value"
0833         I=regexp(strings{i},';','split');
0834         if isfield(miriamStruct{i},'name')
0835             startIndex=numel(miriamStruct{i}.name);
0836             miriamStruct{i}.name=[miriamStruct{i}.name;cell(numel(I),1)];
0837             miriamStruct{i}.value=[miriamStruct{i}.value;cell(numel(I),1)];
0838         else
0839             startIndex=0;
0840             miriamStruct{i}.name=cell(numel(I),1);
0841             miriamStruct{i}.value=cell(numel(I),1);
0842         end
0843 
0844         for j=1:numel(I)
0845             index=max(strfind(I{j},':'));
0846             if any(index)
0847                 miriamStruct{i}.name{startIndex+j}=I{j}(1:index-1);
0848                 miriamStruct{i}.value{startIndex+j}=I{j}(index+1:end);
0849             else
0850                 EM=['"' I{j} '" is not a valid MIRIAM string. The format must be "identifier:value"'];
0851                 dispEM(EM);
0852             end
0853         end
0854     end
0855 end
0856 end
0857 
0858 %For converting a value to string. This is used instead of num2str because
0859 %I want to convert empty cells to {''}.
0860 function y=toStr(x)
0861     %x can be empty, numerical, string or boolean. It cannot be NaN.
0862     %Boolean values will be converted to '1'/'0'
0863     if isempty(x)
0864         y='';
0865     else
0866         y=num2str(x);
0867     end
0868 end
0869 
0870 %For converting to numeric. This is used instead of str2num because I want
0871 %to be able to choose what empty values should be mapped to.
0872 %
0873 % default the value to use for empty input
0874 function y=toDouble(x,default)
0875     if isempty(x) %Note that this catches '' as well
0876         y=default;
0877     else
0878         if isnumeric(x)
0879             y=x;
0880         else
0881             y=str2double(x);
0882 
0883             %This happens if the input couldn't be converted.
0884             %Note that the input itself cannot be NaN since it was fixed in
0885             %clean imported
0886             if isnan(y)
0887                 EM=['Cannot convert the string "' x '" to double'];
0888                 dispEM(EM);
0889             end
0890         end
0891     end
0892 end
0893 
0894 %For converting boolean (the UNCONSTRAINED field) to double (the
0895 %model.unconstrained field)
0896 function y=boolToDouble(x)
0897     if isempty(x)
0898         y=0;
0899         return;
0900     end
0901     if islogical(x)
0902         y=x*1; %Typecast to double
0903         return;
0904     end
0905     if isnumeric(x)
0906        if x~=0
0907            y=1;
0908            return;
0909        else
0910            y=0;
0911            return;
0912        end
0913     end
0914     if ischar(x)
0915        if strcmpi(x,'TRUE')
0916            y=1;
0917            return;
0918        end
0919        if strcmpi(x,'FALSE')
0920            y=0;
0921            return;
0922        end
0923     end
0924     y=NaN; %This means that the input couldn't be parsed
0925 end
